channel.title: No helmet=Super Armor?
channel.description:
So Gordon Freeman in Half Life 1 fought off zombies, aliens and soldiers. Then he kicked everyones ass. In Half Life 2 he's a hero and fights more aliens, zombies and more.
Yet his armor isn't really meant for combat, more of a bio suit. Yet hey lets say he's got the best armor in the world. My question is how does Gordon Freeman's head avoid bullets? He doesn't have one, other HEV suit users wear them.
I mean did the grunts in Half Life 1 not notice his big open head? Or did the headcrabs forget to attack his face? Did the aliens just not see his fleshy head?
Also how do his glasses stay on all the time?
So I want a reason. A funny one, a real one or an extreme one. Either one make up a reason on [b]Why Freeman does not need a helmet[/b]
My idea: He never used a helmet as a child and NEVER fell of his bike.
Glasses: Because they are welded to his head. Duh

item.title: No helmet=Super Armor?
item.dc:creator: The_Bad_Guys
item.description:
He doesn’t: A giant physics-defying wormhole in the shape of an inventory bar hovers slightly above his forehead. He and the bar-shaped wormhole have an intimate understanding and it lends him rocket launchers, guns, and ammunition when he requests it. Nobody says anything about it because it also eats people who acknowledge it.

Stick your dick a reality-bending anomaly and ye shall receive powerful friends indeed.

Read full topic

item.description:

How does he hold all those damn guns?

His HEV suit is powered by TARDIS technology.

item.title: No helmet=Super Armor?
item.dc:creator: Darth_Giorgi
item.description:
danielsangeo:

The HEV suit has a forcefield helmet that is invisible but protects the head from hazardous conditions (such as radiation, poisonous liquids, military engagements) should a regular helmet be missing.

It’s not science. It’s Science.

So to say, HEV MARK IVb-upgraded model.

Read full topic

item.title: No helmet=Super Armor?
item.dc:creator: Mented
item.description:
Infact, scratch that thing about it having uses beyond its intended purpose.

The HEV suit had built in systems for handling weapons, for survey teams crossing over to Xen. So the fact it’s so good with dealing with gunfights, and the blunt trauma of projectiles hitting it is a given.

Read full topic

item.title: No helmet=Super Armor?
item.dc:creator: Mented
item.description:
The HEV suits purpose is in the name. HAZARDOUS ENVIRONMENT SUIT. Just because that had purposes beyond it’s intended use doesn’t mean shit, a gunfight is still a hazardous environment.

As for the helmet. I think it’s implied he has one with him, we just don’t see him take it off/put it back on. Hence why he hasn’t died from radiation sickness. I think it is also implied that whilst headcrabs do attack him, he doesn’t actually let any near his head. The idea headcrabs only lunge at Gordon without coupling is idiotic, that is simply for gameplay purposes.

As someone so rightfully pointed out…

It’s a game.

Read full topic

In Half Life 2 he’s a hero and fights more aliens, zombies and more. Yet his armor isn’t really meant for combat, more of a bio suit. Yet hey lets say he’s got the best armor in the world. My question is how does Gordon Freeman’s head avoid bullets? He doesn’t have one, other HEV suit users wear them. I mean did the grunts in Half Life 1 not notice his big open head? The chuck Norris Meme is dead. please stop using it.

It stopped being funny when it went from laughing at him, to laughing with him. He’s actually a dick in real life. Appeared on Fox and all. Anywho, sorry for the derail.

item.title: No helmet=Super Armor?
item.dc:creator: The_Dude_Man_19
item.description:
I like how some people are acting like I’m having some anal misunderstanding of the fact Half Life is a game. Well no duh. That’s why I said “Funny reasons” as well because anything works.

I’m fully aware it’s a game. If I really was so uptight about game realism I would have ranted about it and had a huge 10 paragraph essay about how 90% of the things in any game [in this case Half Life] are unrealistic and silly.

Second question (already somewhat mentioned): How does he hold all those damn guns?

Read full topic

item.title: No helmet=Super Armor?
item.dc:creator: Kaweebo
item.description:
Storyline speaking, the grunts never hit his head, Gordon dodges every headcrab, probably gets hurt a bit, but obviously not enough to die.

Gameplay wise, you can get attacked until your health bar goes down.
